data.title: Dinner plans
data.solution:
# Auto-generated code below aims at helping you parse
# the standard input according to the problem statement.

n = gets.to_i
k = gets.to_i

hates={}

k.times do
    a, verb, b = gets.split(" ")
    hates[a]=[] if hates[a].nil?
    hates[a].push b
end
seating = gets.chomp.split
seating.push seating.first

seating.each_cons(2){|a,b|
if hates[a]&.include?(b) || hates[b]&.include?(a)
puts false
abort
end}

# Write an action using puts
# To debug: STDERR.puts "Debug messages..."

puts true
data.statement:
You invite [[N]] friends to have dinner at a <<circular>> table.
Given [[K]] requirements, check whether the proposed seating arrangement is acceptable or not.

A <<HATES>> B means A and B <<MUST NOT>> be seated <<next to>> each other.

testCases.title: One requirement
testCases.testIn:
4
1
Walter HATES Joe
Keith Walter Stella Joe

data.stubGenerator:
read N:int
read K:int
loop K read A:word(64) VERB:word(64) B:word(64)
loopline N seat:word(64)
write true/false
data.inputDescription:
<<Line 1:>> An integer [[N]] for the number of friends
<<Line 2:>> An integer [[K]] for the number of requirements
<<Next [[K]] lines:>> Two strings [[A]] and [[B]] separated by a string "HATES"
<<Last line:>> [[N]] space-separated strings representing the proposed seating arrangement, clock-wise
data.outputDescription: <<Line 1:>> A lowercase boolean indicating whether the proposed seating arrangement is acceptable or not.

lastVersion.statementHTML:
Goal

You invite N friends to have dinner at a circular table.
Given K requirements, check whether the proposed seating arrangement is acceptable or not.

A HATES B means A and B MUST NOT be seated next to each other.
Input
Line 1: An integer N for the number of friends
Line 2: An integer K for the number of requirements
Next K lines: Two strings A and B separated by a string "HATES"
Last line: N space-separated strings representing the proposed seating arrangement, clock-wise
Output
Line 1: A lowercase boolean indicating whether the proposed seating arrangement is acceptable or not.
Constraints
0 < N ≤ 100
0 ≤ K ≤ 100
Example
Input
4
1
Walter HATES Joe
Keith Walter Stella Joe
Output
true
